description.en: The main task of the course " Mineral Resources of Future and Mining Technologies " is to introduce potential future Earth resources in general and assess the Estonian resource potential. In this course resource criticality will be assessed and a brief introduction will be given into the future demand of technological metals in the progress of societal sustainability. Potential Estonian Earth resources will be introduced. The main exploration methods and mining technologies will be acquired. An overview about the natural and socio-economic principles of exploitation of Earth' resources will be provided.
description.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on anda ülevaade tulevikumaavaradest üldiselt ja Eesti võimalustest selles vallas, defineerida kriitilise toorme olemus ja tutvustada säästvale arengule üleminekul olulisi metalle ja teisi maapõuevarasid. Õpitakse tundma Eesti potensiaalseid tulevikumaavarasid. Kursuse raames tutvustatakse põhilisi ja uusi maapõueressursside uuringumeetodeid ja võimalikke tuleviku kaevandamismeetodeid. Antakse ülevaade looduslikest ja sotsiaal-majanduslikest piirangutest maapõueressursside kasutamisel.

objectives.en: Overview about the future Earth resources, as a general approach and as in Estonian perspective, resource criticality and global policy, about the metals which are important in support of sustainable development, new exploration and mining technologies.
objectives.et: Ülevaade tulevikumaavaradest üldiselt ja Eesti võimalustest, kriitilisest toormest, globaalsest maavarapoliitikast, säästvale arengule üleminekul olulistest loodusvaradest, tehnoloogiatest, maavarade uuringute ja kaevandamise uutest lahendustest.

learning_outcomes.en: 1. knows the most important future Earth' resources
2. knows the concept of critical raw materials and assessment bases for Earth resources criticality
learning_outcomes.et: 2. Teab kriitilise toorme kontseptsiooni ja ressursside kritikaalsuse aspekte

learning_outcomes.en: 3. knows the main trends of global natural resource policy
4. knows the main and new exploration methods and mining technologies
learning_outcomes.et: 4. Teab põhilisi ja uusi uuringu- ja kaevandamismeetodeid

learning_outcomes.en: 5. knows potential future mineral resources of Estonia
6. knows geological and socio-economic principles of exploitation of natural resources
learning_outcomes.et: 6. Teab loodusvarade kasutamise looduslikke ja sotsiaal-majanduslikke kriteeriume

independent_work.et: Will be provided during the first lecture.

description.et:
Written report
The written report needs to have a logical structure in the scientific report style (title page, table of content, chapters, references, etc.) with necessary graphics and tables.
The presentation of the report should summarize the most important findings provided in the written report. The presenter needs to be able to answer questions regarding the presentation.

Written exam
The exam involves topics covered during the lectures and colloquiums.

grade_preconditions.et: A written report needs to be submitted and presented in order to attend the written exam.

grade_evaluation.et: A written report and presentation and a written exam (in Moodle) have to be done for passing the course. Report+presentation = maximum 30 points; Exam = maximum 70 points. The exam has to be taken with a total score of more than 35 points.

debt_elimination.et: Need to discussed with the teaching stuff.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
